alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Choctaw, northwestern Washington, Wayne and north central Greene Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 435 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Mill Creek to 9 miles south of Clara. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Clara, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas, Gilbertown and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
